meanings.definition: A sample or preview of a taste or flavor.
meanings.sent1: I took a small pretaste of the soup to see if it was too salty.
meanings.sent2: The bakery offered a pretaste of their new cake to customers.
meanings.sent3: The pretaste of the ice cream made me excited for the full scoop.
meanings.sent4: Her pretaste of success in baking motivated her to enter a competition.
meanings.sent5: The pretaste of the exotic fruit lingered on his tongue.

meanings.definition: To taste beforehand or in advance.
meanings.sent1: Before serving the dish, the chef will pretaste it for seasoning.
meanings.sent2: She likes to pretaste the soup while cooking to adjust the flavors.
meanings.sent3: He pretasted the sauce and added more herbs for extra flavor.
meanings.sent4: The food critic pretasted the new menu items before writing the review.
meanings.sent5: The chef pretasted the dessert to ensure it was perfect for the guests.
